name: tidyread---streamline-your-daily-reading
title: TidyRead - Streamline Your Daily Reading
description: An AI-powered digest tool based on RSS feeds. Enhance controlled, efficient, and organized information intake. More at https://tidyread.info.
author: jaredliu233

commands.name: manage-source-list.command
commands.title: Manage Sources
commands.subtitle: TidyRead
commands.description: Manage your reading sources, including adding, editing, deleting, and scheduling.

commands.name: daily-read.command
commands.title: Daily Read
commands.subtitle: TidyRead
commands.description: Show your daily reading list and digest.

commands.name: add-source.command
commands.title: Add Source
commands.subtitle: TidyRead
commands.description: Create and schedule your read source.

commands.name: auto-digest.command
commands.title: Auto Digest
commands.subtitle: TidyRead
commands.description: Enable the auto digest feature to receive daily digest notifications at the `notificationTime` specified in the extension preferences panel.

preferences.name: apiKey
preferences.description: Enter your API Key for your provider
preferences.title: API Key

preferences.name: apiModel
preferences.title: API Model
preferences.description: Choose an API model for your provider

preferences.name: maxTokens
preferences.description: Maximum number of tokens output for AI Summarizing. No need to set this value for Raycast AI.
preferences.title: Max Tokens

preferences.name: preferredLanguage
preferences.description: Summarize the content within 50-200 characters, directly output. Focusing strictly on its core insights. Exclude promotional content, including podcast listening options, subscription offers, access instructions, and any form of contact details for additional services. Most important, respond in {{lang}}.
preferences.title: Preferred Language

preferences.name: notificationTime
preferences.description: Notification time for daily digest, e.g.: 9am, 10:30pm.
preferences.title: Notification Time

preferences.name: apiHost
preferences.description: If you deploy your own api proxy, you can fill in the host of the api proxy here, including the https prefix, e.g.: https://gpt.yourdomain.com
preferences.title: API Host

preferences.name: httpProxy
preferences.description: Proxy for each request, e.g.: http://127.0.0.1:33210
preferences.title: Http Proxy

preferences.name: summarizePrompt
preferences.description: For each RSS item, it will be summarized by the provider, and you can customize the summarize prompt
preferences.title: Summarize Prompt
preferences.default: Summarize the content within 50 to 200 characters, excluding any references to author publicity and promotion. The summary should be straightforward and in {{lang}}.

preferences.name: maxItemsPerFeed
preferences.description: Maximum number of item pulls per RSS feed
preferences.title: Max Items Per RSS Feed

preferences.name: maxApiConcurrency
preferences.description: Maximum number of concurrent calls to the AI api for summarizing
preferences.title: Max Summarize API Concurrency

preferences.name: retryCount
preferences.description: AI API request retry count. Assuming you set it to 5, it means that it will retry 5 times with `Retry Delay` intervals. If you encounter a `Rate Limit` error in digest, you can try to increase this value.
preferences.title: AI API Retry Count

preferences.name: retryDelay
preferences.description: AI API request retry delay. Assuming you set it to 30, means retry after 30 seconds. If you encounter a `Rate Limit` error, you can try to increase this value.
preferences.title: AI API Retry Delay

preferences.name: requestTimeout
preferences.description: Timeout for each request, default is 30 seconds
preferences.title: Request Timeout

preferences.name: writeFreelyEndpoint
preferences.description: For generating shareable digest link. If you deploy your own writefreely instance, or use a community instance, you can fill in the endpoint of the writefreely instance here, including the https prefix, e.g.: https://writefreely.yourdomain.com. Default is https://paper.wf.
preferences.title: WriteFreely Endpoint

preferences.name: splitByTags
preferences.description: Whether digest content is categorized by label
preferences.title: Enable Digest Split By Tags
preferences.label: Enable

preferences.name: enableItemLinkProxy
preferences.description: The article links in digest will be redirected to the official website of tidyread by default, for the purpose of usage statistics and the possible addition of structured reading features in the future. If you think this affects your normal use, you can disable it.
preferences.title: Enable Article Link Proxy
preferences.label: Enable
